newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says March oil output up 4.1 pct vs yr ago.
newsitem.headline: Peru says March oil output up 4.1 pct vs yr ago.

text.p: Peru produced an average of 123,700 barrels per day (bpd) of crude oil in March, up 4.1 percent from the same month last year, the Energy and Mines Ministry said Thursday.
Output in the first three months rose 2.7 percent to 120,600 bpd, compared with the same period in 1996, the ministry added in its monthly report.
Total oil production in Peru dropped 2.9 percent in 1996 to an average of 118,300 bpd of crude.
U.S.-based firms Occidental Petroleum Corp and Petro-Tech S.A., Argentina's Pluspetrol and state oil company Petroperu S.A. account for more than 90 percent of Peru's total oil output.
